Action.Description: It specifies the action that is to be performed if the button/Key is clicked / activated.

Action List.Description: Lists the Key Names which are to be triggered in sequence when this button/key is clicked / activated.
Action List.Name: Action List

ActionEx.Description: Use ActionEx to specify multiple actions for execution on invoking a key or button.

ActionEx.Name: ActionEx

Add/Replace/Delete.Description: The ADD/Delete/Replace modifiers are used in a definition to Add/Delete/Replace an attribute to the Definition.
Add/Replace/Delete.Name: Add/Replace/Delete

Background.Description: This attribute specifies the background color for the button.
Background.Name: Background

Border.Description: This attribute specifies the border for the button.
Border.Name: Border

BottomToolbar Position.Description: Specifies the position of the key in bottom toolbar starting from BottomToolBarBtn1 to BottomToolBarBtn10.
BottomToolbar Position.Name: BottomToolbar Position

Cancel.Description: It is used to deactivate the button based on some condition.
Cancel.Name: Cancel

Color.Description: This attribute specifies the foreground color for the title of the button.
Color.Name: Color

Focus BG.Description: This attribute specifies the background color of the button when it is focused.

Meta.Aliases: Focus BG, Focus BG Color, Focus BG Colour, Focus BG Shade

Focus BG.Name: Focus BG

Height.Description: This attribute specifies the height of the button.
Height.Name: Height

Help.Description: Specifies the Index / Id of the help file for help.
Help.Name: Help

Horizontal Align.Description: This attribute specifies the horizontal alignment of the button. The default alignment is left.

Parameters.Keywords: Bottom, Center, Centre, Justified, Left, Prompt, Right, Top

Horizontal Align.Name: Horizontal Align

Image.Description: This attribute is used to draw the image from the specified resource.
Image.Name: Image

Inactive Color.Description: This attribute specifies the foreground  color of key and title of the button when it is inactive.

Meta.Aliases: Inactive Color, Inactive Colour, Inactive Shade

Inactive Color.Name: Inactive Color

Key.Description: This attribute is used to give a unique key combination which is used to trigger the button/key when associated at various interfaces.
Key.Name: Key

Key Color.Description: This attribute specifies the foreground color of the key of the button.

Meta.Aliases: Key Color, Key Colour, Key Shade

Key Color.Name: Key Color

Key Style.Description: This attribute specifies the style for the key of the button.
Key Style.Name: Key Style

Key Vertical Align.Description: This attribute specifies the vertical alignment for the key of the button. The default alignment is same as vertical alignment of the button.

Parameters.Keywords: Bottom, Center, Centre, Justified, Left, Prompt, Right, Top

Meta.Aliases: Key Vertical Align, Key Vertical Alignment

Key Vertical Align.Name: Key Vertical Align

Line.Description: This attribute specifies the number of lines for the title of the button.

Meta.Aliases: Line, Lines, Top Line, Top Lines

Line.Name: Line

Mode.Description: Specifies whether the action of the key has to be performed in Display mode, Edit mode or both the modes.
Mode.Name: Mode

Modifier Button.Description: This attribute specifies a dynamic modifier for the button. This allows the same button to be extended using modifier keys (E.g. Crtl, Alt, Shift) for another action.

Meta.Aliases: Modifier Button, Modifier Buttons, Modifier Key, Modifier Keys

Modifier Button.Name: Modifier Button

Option.Description: Option is an attribute which can be used by various definitions, to provide a conditional result in a program.
Option.Name: Option

Scope.Description: It specifies the scope for the action which is to be performed.

Parameters.Keywords: All Lines, Current Line, Dashboard, Line, None, Report, Selected Lines, Unselected Lines

Scope.Name: Scope

Skip Forward.Description: This attribute skips the button while navigating forward. The focus comes back to the button when the key backsapce is pressed from the next button.
Skip Forward.Name: Skip Forward

Space Left.Description: This attribute specifies space to be left on the left side of the button.
Space Left.Name: Space Left

Space Right.Description: This attribute specifies space to be left on the right side of the button.
Space Right.Name: Space Right

Style.Description: This attribute specifies the style for the title of the button.
Style.Name: Style

Switch.Description: 'Switch' attribute is similar to the Option attribute but reduces code complexity and improves the performance. The Switch are grouped using a label Once a condition is satisfied from one group, switch won't  check further conditions from the same group.  It will evaluate the conditions from the other groups specified, if any.
Switch.Name: Switch

Title.Description: It can be used to give a meaningful Title to the Button being displayed on the Button Bar.
Title.Name: Title

Tooltip.Description: Specifies the tooltip text to be displayed on mouse hover.
Tooltip.Name: Tooltip

Type.Description: It specifies the category of buttons.
Type.Name: Type

Use.Description: The USE keyword is used in a definition to reuse an existing definition.
Use.Name: Use

Vertical Align.Description: This attribute specifies the vertical alignment of the button. The default alignment is center.

Parameters.Keywords: Bottom, Center, Centre, Justified, Left, Prompt, Right, Top

Vertical Align.Name: Vertical Align

Width.Description: This attribute specifies the width of the button.
Width.Name: Width
